The word was used to designate a group of people who were travelling by camel or horse on the Silk Road. Doublet of Kairouan.

entries.meaning: A convoy or procession of travelers, their vehicles and cargo, and any pack animals, especially camels crossing a desert.
examples: Synonyms: camel train, convoy, pack train, wagon train

entries.meaning: (UK, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa) A furnished vehicle towed behind a car, etc., and used as a dwelling when stationary.
examples: Synonyms: camper (US), motor home, recreational vehicle, RV, trailer, travel trailer

verbs.description: caravan (third-person singular simple present caravans, present participle caravaning or caravanning, simple past and past participle caravaned or caravanned)

examples: The wedding party got in their cars and caravaned from the chapel to the reception hall.

entries.meaning: (UK, Australia) To travel and/or live in a caravan (vehicle).
examples: When my parents retired they really got back into caravanning.
